text: The New York air was crisp and calm on the night of April 14, 1998. But inside the Beacon Theater on Manhattan ’ s Upper West Side, a fire blazed. The faithful had gathered. A religious ceremony was to take place. Six deities waited in the wings, but they needn ’ t proselytize upon taking the stage. Every sane soul had already kneeled at their altar, and would do so again for several years to come. The event, of course, was VH1 ′ s “ Divas Live. ” The gods were pop prima donnas : Aretha Franklin, Mariah Carey, Céline Dion, Gloria Estefan, Shania Twain and Carole King who, separately and together, performed numbers from their respective catalogs.
